title: Maria Sharapova
summary: Maria Yuryevna Sharapova (UK: /ˌʃærəˈpoʊvə/ SHARE-ə-POH-və, US: /ˌʃɑːr-/ SHAR-;[4] Russian: Мария Юрьевна Шарапова, IPA: [mɐˈrʲijə ʂɐˈrapəvə] (listen); born 19 April 1987) is a Russian former world No. 1 tennis player. Although she played under the banner of Russia with the Women's Tennis Association (WTA), she has lived in and been a United States permanent resident since 1994.[5] Sharapova competed on the WTA Tour from 2001 to 2020 and had been ranked world No. 1 in singles by the WTA on five separate occasions, for a total of 21 weeks. She is one of ten women, and the only Russian, to hold the career Grand Slam. She is also an Olympic medalist, having won a silver medal in women's singles at the 2012 Summer Olympics in London.
